revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 22:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Return request-id to APIs that don't respond with a body

Request-IDs help track actions initiated via the API.
With this patch, we can supply the request ID in the
following APIs:
- POST {resource}/action APIs for actions such as
  'reset-state', 'force-delete', 'shrink',
  'extend', 'manage', 'deny_access', 'addProjectAccess',
  'removeProjectAccess', 'promote', 'resync', 'unmanage',
  'revert', 'migration_start', 'migration_complete',
  'migration_cancel'
- POST /share_unmanage/{id}
- DELETE /{resource}/{id} APIs for
  shares, share networks, share groups, share replicas,
  security services, share servers, share snapshots,
  extra specs, messages, quota sets, share-group-snapshots,
  group specs, share-group-types, share types

Change-Id: I64ed14b5a44d6e1b37cfc9321b25bdf4e0aabea5
Closes-Bug: #1815532
"}]
commit_message:
Return request-id to APIs that don't respond with a body

Request-IDs help track actions initiated via the API.
With this patch, we can supply the request ID in the
following APIs:
- POST {resource}/action APIs for actions such as
  'reset-state', 'force-delete', 'shrink',
  'extend', 'manage', 'deny_access', 'addProjectAccess',
  'removeProjectAccess', 'promote', 'resync', 'unmanage',
  'revert', 'migration_start', 'migration_complete',
  'migration_cancel'
- POST /share_unmanage/{id}
- DELETE /{resource}/{id} APIs for
  shares, share networks, share groups, share replicas,
  security services, share servers, share snapshots,
  extra specs, messages, quota sets, share-group-snapshots,
  group specs, share-group-types, share types

Change-Id: I64ed14b5a44d6e1b37cfc9321b25bdf4e0aabea5
Closes-Bug: #1815532

commit_message:
Add unit tests for tempest cleanup

In the previous patches, tempest cleanup got improved
and new methods were implemented. This review adds
more unit tests to exercise those changes and to
improve tempest cleanup test coverage.

Change-Id: Ibf30162e49a8cf87accdbe7f0a6cc38941873d5e
Related-Bug: #1812660

Edit service classes so that they discover initial
state of resources before deleting any.

Unify service names - f.e. if a service returns resources
in a list named server_groups, server_groups should be
the key of initial resources in the saved_state.json.

When is_preserve is True, security groups in
NetworkSecGroupService were filtered by networks present
in tempest.conf, however, these groups are associated
with a project_id, therefore it should be filtered
against projects present in tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I97d0115bbb43a089b33602df7c98e153984ceaf1
Related-Bug: #1812660
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest cleanup

Edit service classes so that they discover initial
state of resources before deleting any.

Unify service names - f.e. if a service returns resources
in a list named server_groups, server_groups should be
the key of initial resources in the saved_state.json.

When is_preserve is True, security groups in
NetworkSecGroupService were filtered by networks present
in tempest.conf, however, these groups are associated
with a project_id, therefore it should be filtered
against projects present in tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I97d0115bbb43a089b33602df7c98e153984ceaf1
Related-Bug: #1812660

commit_message:
Update requirements for ubuntu

My test to build octavia amphora on Ubuntu Xenial was missing kpartx
package.
So I propose to update README.rst to help users build the image
correctly.

Also refactor a little bit how it is presented.

Change-Id: I65cf2ce25e96b4f44e2ca76884ec79831eb1c7f4
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

Switch multinode grenade jobs to python3

neutron-grenade stays on python 2 and we already have grenade-py3 job
for single node python 3

commit_message:
use payloads for SECURITY_GROUP BEFORE_CREATE events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for SECURITY_GROUP BEFORE_CREATE events.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Change-Id: Id48d1d0ec429011310571a7b43ffbb4a6d9f1610

commit_message:
Fix notification about arp entries for dvr routers

In method _generate_arp_table_and_notify_agent in neutron.db.l3_dvr_db
module notifiations about arp table was send only to one router
connected to subnet.
Now it will check if subnet is connected to more than one
dvr router and will send same notification to all such routers.

Closes-Bug: #1815913

Change-Id: I6a7d7f6645a8a7b5219788d51e17d54844d145bc
(cherry picked from commit 1f104a093c1f27ddb1967e72cd452d43120b4cc2)
(cherry picked from commit 3af8e2719c772097c579c65fe088fea6a1f56a4d)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

NOTE: legacy-neutron-fwaas-dsvm-functional is failing.
This needs to be fixed in a separate patch.

Change-Id: I71dc6449c64b9a9f974d83e51423a7c67a42c551

commit_message:
Replace httplib2 by requests

The functional tests sometimes fail to start the elasticsearch
instance. This patchset is proposed to fix that issue.

Change-Id: Iaa8ccc83a40489c5116451b2e71cc3c3e63e11bc
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

It seems nova has changed defaults on who can create zero-sized disk
instances [1] and now some devstack jobs, like nodepool's, can't
create cirros images using this flavor.  It seems the easiest thing to

commit_message:
Update cirros256 flavor to have some disk

It seems nova has changed defaults on who can create zero-sized disk
instances [1] and now some devstack jobs, like nodepool's, can't
create cirros images using this flavor.  It seems the easiest thing to
do is just to bump it up.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603910/

Change-Id: I1172d4775d608568ccbeb27e2975d83add892ea9

commit_message:
Retrieve devices with link not present

In ip_lib.get_devices_info(), privileged.get_link_devices() can return
devices with links not present in this namespace or not listed. In this
situation, get_devices_info() will always try to find the device to set
the parameter "parent_name", what will trigger an exception.

This patch solves this issue avoiding the population of "parent_name"
if the link device is not present in the devices list.

Change-Id: Ic5c7d9008a11da5c406dc383cfdae2892a3118d8
Closes-Bug: #1815758

commit_message:
Bump pyroute2 version to 0.5.3

Bump pyroute2 version to 0.5.3 in order to retrieve the latest updates
and features.

A code refactor and reorganization was done between version 0.5.1 and
0.5.2. In order to enforce the new code structure, the version should
be bumped to the last stable one.

Change-Id: Ia75186570e7a320a3fbdf35bd01ec43dc071f6e8
Closes-Bug: #1814143

I tested this and got the same results which I added in commit message of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632479/ i.e "I have tested on devstack setup with defaults for DB max_pool_size and
max_overflow and with 6 neutron api_workers and 6 keystone workers.
When I tried to create 300 security group rules for same security group,
without this patch, mysqld connections went to 280 and was using above
200 connections most of the time and max time taken for the API was
300 seconds (many API calls were taking 300 seconds and some calls were
failing). With this patch, DB connections went to 200 but came back to
70 soon and was remaining in 70s for the API calls. All calls were
successful and also max response time taken was 30 seconds."

POST request response times for 300 security group rules creation http://paste.openstack.org/show/744727/

script I used to create 300 security group rules asynchronously http://paste.openstack.org/show/744728/'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2019-02-08 14:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Still many api tests are failing and it looks like it is related to this patch http://logs.openstack.org/71/635671/4/check/neutron-tempest-plugin-api/67253c5/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz?level=ERROR'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-09 15:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Still many api tests are failing and it looks like it is related to
 > this patch http://logs.openstack.org/71/635671/4/check/neutron-tempest-plugin-api/67253c5/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz?level=ERROR

There is a race condition in the "expire on foreign keys" logic which I have struggled to identify how it occurs in I57b91cc52ed31e4ea0242edb8de8b1beff6706ab .   (Note I wrote this logic and added many new behaviors to it at Ihar's request and it would be vastly preferable if Neutron did not need to use hacks like this).

My current impression is that this is a race that already existed that is only being exposed by timing changes as a result of this patch because the nature of the failure is unrelated to what is happening here, however since I still can't understand how the condition occurs nothing can be ruled out.

How hard is it to run tempest locally and run just one of these tests ?'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-09 18:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-09 18:21:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Anil -

In this revision I have restored the assertion that the revision number is not being bumped by more than one. In a related review I have observed that the tempest run does exercise this occurring, and it is not clear if skipping this conflict leads to problems later.    So far this suggests that my original theory that Neutron is relying upon the compare-and-swap behavior of SQLAlhcemy's version_id_col feature may be correct.    

I'm running the assertion here in Python after the mass update has run.   If you can run this version of things through your tests, perhaps it still is more performant than how things were before, but it's not clear.   

If this still does not resolve the related tempest failure then I will keep trying to figure out why that's happening.  It's a pretty intricate two-concurrent-Network objects condition that from my POV should not be possible, and it's not clear maybe this is an artifact of the test suite (like side effects from the previous teardown).   It also might be safe to ignore which is what is currently proposed at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635706/."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-09 19:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/635671/5 : SUCCESS in 1h 36m 31s'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-09 23:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

OK, I figured out the issue.   It is the interaction of the revision_plugin with the flush process, as well as Neutron's liberal use of the "load_on_pending" flag which is another part of the "do things from an FK perspective" pattern.  It is because I moved the operation into the "after_flush" step, which still is a good place to emit the SQL, however, to scan through the objects, it is loading a Network object from the database, however this Network object is still waiting to be established as part of the session's state, so when the flush continues you now have the same Network object twice.    So my initial impression that the "expire the collections" plugin was tripping over something that shouldn't be happening in any case was accurate.

I can reorganize things to fix this.  It's just been 12 hours of sending crap up to zuul each time to figure out what was going on in the tempest run.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-09 23:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

here's the MCVE for what was happening:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/744794/

now, a simple unit test in neutron itself should be able to test for this.  not sure why none of the unit tests find this, it seems the revision_plugin is normally turned off."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-09 23:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-10 00:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-18 16:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

to clarify my previous comment, innodb is not locking the whole table but it is using gap locks: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/innodb-locking.html#innodb-gap-locks

also, the UPDATE we emit is all records at once so the issue of two transactions hitting the records in reverse order should be prevented as both UPDATE statements scan the table in the same order.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-18 16:39:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

whoops, not even gap locks, in the test I ran I didn't set the id as primary key.  

OK so when id is set as primary key it does lock on the index, so if we were to emit two UPDATE statements against primary keys 1 and 2 and the other transaction did it in the order of 2 and 1, one transaction can fail due to the deadlock created by that scenario.  However, we aren't UPDATEing one row at a time, we're doing them all in one statement using UPDATE...WHERE id IN ... so this particular locking scenario should not be possible if we are to assume MySQL locks the rows in the same order each time, or if there is some other level of atomicity going on.   I've put this out on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54751671/can-two-innodb-update-statements-against-a-pk-index-deadlock-if-they-are-given-a to get additional detail.

Overall, this change only bumps the version id for related rows.   The UPDATEs will likely never fail or if they were, it would be at a vastly lower rate than how much they fail now."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/635671/8 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 14s'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-18 20:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-18 20:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

so I'm not sure what the error in the neutron svc logs for the tempest run are, however the actual failure seems to be a simple race getting back the updated_at value for a port is one second greater than the value we got while creating it.  I would think that the port object is the official "versioned" object so we'd be using the normal versioning routine to bump the version number and get the value back, however that the test fails here suggests that the port is in some way subject to the non-versioned routine, which isn't refreshing the updated_at value for the row in memory.  the latest patch 9 adds that in to see if it resolves.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-18 23:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/635671/9 : SUCCESS in 1h 43m 17s'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2019-02-19 06:45:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

http://logs.openstack.org/71/635671/9/check/neutron-tempest-dvr/6cd2f65/controller/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz?level=ERROR'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-19 12:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

Thanks Michael for the details, we all learn something, it really helps.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:38:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I see only one DB error there and it is not immediately related, however if the application just runs differently since it is locking less or running SQL more quickly it's difficult to know if this kind of deadlock would become more frequent."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-19 23:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

'}, {'created': '2019-02-09 18:16:25.000000000', 'message': 'Run revision bump operations en masse

Refactored RevisionPlugin to operate upon sets of objects at
once.   In the case of "related" objects, the bump operation
no longer makes use of compare-and-swap and instead updates
version numbers directly without testing for their previous value.

While this is intended to mitigate the issue of StaleDataErrors being
prevalent within the related object update phase, given the assumption
that the compare-and-swap logic is only desireable for the primary object
being updated, tempest tests are showing this is not the case, and that we
may need to maintain the StaleDataError in this case as well.  We will
attempt to still raise the StaleDataError as before, but instead using
the technique of comparing the revision identifiers after the mass
UPDATE has occurred.  This may or may not defeat the purpose of the
change.

We are also for the moment vendoring in I8d0321487e4b406ead7a237156ef2f221fb512b9
which applies currently broken event listening logic twice; neutron-lib
now runs this where in the below review we have made it more safe against
multiple sessions.  There should not be multiple sessions of course, which is
being researched in I57b91cc52ed31e4ea0242edb8de8b1beff6706ab.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635706/
Change-Id: I2fef298041c59a03dfd06912764973995b80690c

commit_message:
Run revision bump operations en masse

Refactored RevisionPlugin to operate upon sets of objects at
once.   In the case of "related" objects, the bump operation
no longer makes use of compare-and-swap and instead updates
version numbers directly without testing for their previous value.
This removes the issue of StaleDataErrors being
prevalent within the related object update phase, given the assumption
that the compare-and-swap logic is only desireable for the primary object
being updated.

Change-Id: I2fef298041c59a03dfd06912764973995b80690c

subject: Add health_status and health_status_reason to cluster
messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-28 18:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-28 22:33:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-28 23:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-29 00:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-29 01:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-29 21:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-30 04:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 9995, 'date': '2018-06-05 21:40:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

If we go with the separate status, what's the impact for the client interactions? Will we show the cluster status or the health status, or both, when doing a cluster list? Will a user be able to retrieve the config for a cluster in CREATE_FAILED/UNHEALTHY, when UNHEALTHY is due to one misbehaving node? Or do we look directly into the 'api_server' of the HEALTH_REASON to decide if this is possible?"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-10 18:53:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi Ricarodo, all good questions. Please see my comments in line.

* If we go with the separate status, what's the impact for the client interactions?

Nothing? But user will be able to see the health_status and health_status_reason field when show cluster.

* Will we show the cluster status or the health status, or both, when doing a cluster list?

See above.


* Will a user be able to retrieve the config for a cluster in CREATE_FAILED/UNHEALTHY, when UNHEALTHY is due to one misbehaving node?

Yes, if it's a work node misbehaving. Because we would like to make sure user can talk to the cluster as much as we can, so that user can get more insights by kubectl/API.

* Or do we look directly into the 'api_server' of the HEALTH_REASON to decide if this is possible?

Based on the design of k8s, getting the health status of worker/minion node is easy, we can just reuse /nodes API. However, the master nodes status is a little bit tricky. Though we can get the status of master nodes by /componentstatuses, which can let us know the components status of master. But seems there is no way to let us know some low level information, such as if the disk is low. However, at least we can just use /nodes API to know if the node (either master or minion) is in Ready status. That's basically enough for us for stage 1. We just need carefully define the structure of the health_status field and health_status_reason field, so that we can easily parse the value and improve the health checking algorithm in Magnum."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-15 02:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-15 02:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-26 02:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

@Ricardo, @Spyros, really need you guys comments here to roll the ball. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-28 06:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

lgtm, just update with this story:
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002742'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-28 06:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I have created this worklist
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/worklist/389'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2018-06-28 10:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-08-20 23:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-08-22 02:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-08-27 02:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-08-30 13:25:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Do you want to add here the api-ref and reno?

the rest LGTM'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-08-31 04:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Can we do that with a following patch? Which could make the review easier I think.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-09-03 08:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-09-03 08:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> Can we do that with a following patch? Which could make the review
 > easier I think.

sounds good'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-02-21 02:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 2e078ed54a4f1b7d8e24d05afaef034ee442f21a'}]

There are some side changes, which are worth to mention in commit message:

- changes in part of tc_lib related to tbf_bw_limits are made
- instead of update_tbf_bw_limit, set_tbf_bw_limit is used for updating
- in ip_lib function are made public (interface change)

Commit message states only part of that commit.

Split into two or three changes could be tricky, so I would like to ask you to update commit message about it.'}, {'account_id': 25618, 'date': '2019-02-06 12:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

I guess I got the idea of change. Those changes in tc_lib are related to usage of pyroute2.

Anyway it is worth to mention that update_tbf_bw_limit is no longer available and set_tbf_bw_limit could be use as a replacement.

It is a change of API library and IMO deprecation of lib API should be noted.'}, {'account_id': 25618, 'date': '2019-02-06 13:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)

commit_message:
Implement add_tc_qdisc and list_tc_qdiscs using pyroute2

TcCommand.set_tbf_bw_limit() is used now to set and replace a TC TBF
filter.

Related-Bug: #1560963

Change-Id: I162dea499d16db76692dd3d6d99b6be45f44ae59

[{'created': '2019-02-15 18:26:41.000000000', 'message': 'use api def ALIAS in _supported_extension_aliases

Today a number of classes define their _supported_extension_aliases
using static strings rather than API definition ALIASes. This patch
switches them to use the ALIAS where applicable.

Change-Id: Id3be9ff7d84811c05793811306a13262fd3c0787
'}]
commit_message:
use api def ALIAS in _supported_extension_aliases

Today a number of classes define their _supported_extension_aliases
using static strings rather than API definition ALIASes. This patch
switches them to use the ALIAS where applicable.

Change-Id: Id3be9ff7d84811c05793811306a13262fd3c0787

commit_message:
Add common neutron config options to status CLI tool

In neutron-status upgrade check tool config options from
core_common_config_opts group are registered as some of them
are necessary by e.g. fwaas check proposed in [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/637203

Change-Id: I93c97f5458c9d120e5d76508c282f57d8bfea120

commit_message:
Fix node lock aquire to force with node operation

This patch fixes the node_operation action to properly
steal the lock for the node. This is to prevent failures
when a delete action is using node_stop_on_delete.

Change-Id: I97fbc126bef4cd1bec65201320365cf6fa2f41e4

commit_message:
Fix notification about arp entries for dvr routers

In method _generate_arp_table_and_notify_agent in neutron.db.l3_dvr_db
module notifiations about arp table was send only to one router
connected to subnet.
Now it will check if subnet is connected to more than one
dvr router and will send same notification to all such routers.

Closes-Bug: #1815913

Change-Id: I6a7d7f6645a8a7b5219788d51e17d54844d145bc

commit_message:
Fix some driver library bugs

This patch corrects some python3 byte string issues in the driver
library callbacks.
It also corrects an issue where multiple update calls may cause a
bad file descriptor error.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 10:13:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add new test decorator skip_if_timeout

In some cases our db migration tests which run on MySQL are
failing with timeout and it happens due to slow VMs on which
job is running.
Sometimes it may also happen that timeout exception is raised
in the middle of some sqlalchemy operations and
sqlalchemy.InterfaceError is raised as last one.
Details about this exception can be found in [1].

To avoid many rechecks because of this reason this patch
introduces new decorator which is very similar to "unstable_test"
but will skip test only if one of exceptions mentioned above will
be raised.
In all other cases it will fail test.

That should be a bit more safe for us because we will not miss
some other failures raised in those tests and will avoid rechecks
because of this "well-known" reason described in related bug.

[1] http://sqlalche.me/e/rvf5

Change-Id: Ie291fda7d23a696aaa1160d126a3cf72b08c522f
Related-Bug: #1687027
'}]
commit_message:
Add new test decorator skip_if_timeout

In some cases our db migration tests which run on MySQL are
failing with timeout and it happens due to slow VMs on which
job is running.
Sometimes it may also happen that timeout exception is raised
in the middle of some sqlalchemy operations and
sqlalchemy.InterfaceError is raised as last one.
Details about this exception can be found in [1].

To avoid many rechecks because of this reason this patch
introduces new decorator which is very similar to "unstable_test"
but will skip test only if one of exceptions mentioned above will
be raised.
In all other cases it will fail test.

That should be a bit more safe for us because we will not miss
some other failures raised in those tests and will avoid rechecks
because of this "well-known" reason described in related bug.

[1] http://sqlalche.me/e/rvf5

Change-Id: Ie291fda7d23a696aaa1160d126a3cf72b08c522f
Related-Bug: #1687027

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/627285/7 : SUCCESS in 1h 47m 28s'}, {'account_id': 4187, 'date': '2019-01-24 17:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

Is there a reason we can't be more selective about the ports we update status for? Is the thinking that if we don't find the expected number of keepalived processes that the node is an unhealthy state and just needs to be re-synced? If so, that's completely valid. I'm just thinking out loud and wondering if we could get more selective about which router ports to reset state on based on whether the router appears to be healthy or not."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-01-25 01:35:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Is there a reason we can't be more selective about the ports we
 > update status for? Is the thinking that if we don't find the
 > expected number of keepalived processes that the node is an
 > unhealthy state and just needs to be re-synced? If so, that's
 > completely valid. I'm just thinking out loud and wondering if we
 > could get more selective about which router ports to reset state on
 > based on whether the router appears to be healthy or not.

I've considered that, it will need to refactor some code, I can give the potential workflow:
(1) get HA router IDs from the neturon-server
(2) check if every HA router's processes （keepavlied, monitor, meta-proxy, etc） are running OK
(3) shutdown the half/stale/bad processes
(4) put those bad state HA router IDs into full sync list
(5) let the agent re-configure it
This is really complicated and far beyond this bug and fix. But maybe the fetch_and_sync_all_routers are doing that now."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-01-25 02:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-01-25 04:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Not set the HA port down at regular l3-agent restart

If l3-agent was restarted by a regular action, such as config change,
package upgrade, manually service restart etc. We should not set the
HA port down during such scenarios. Unless the physical host was
rebooted, aka the VRRP processes were all terminated.

This patch adds a new RPC call during l3 agent init, it will try to
retrieve the HA router count first. And then compare the VRRP process
(keepalived) count and 'neutron-keepalived-state-change' count
with the hosting router count. If the count matches, then that
set HA port to 'DOWN' state action will not be triggered anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1798475
Change-Id: I5e2bb64df0aaab11a640a798963372c8d91a06a8

commit_message:
remove string use of neutron.common.rpc

We already removed the rpc module from neutron [1], but we missed a
string reference to it in the hacking tests. This cosmetic change
uses neutron/common/util.py rather than rpc.py that's now removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: Ib432205525eeb3f5e3e64b56fef0f153d119bb95

I'm reintroducing my -1 because I don't think that you gave sufficient thought to what I was saying.

This new configuration option is a classic example of:
https://assafmuller.com/2017/05/19/when-is-not-cool-to-add-a-new-openstack-configuration-option/

We should not add it. We should instead calculate a better value."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-10 09:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-10 10:13:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I'm reintroducing my -1 because I don't think that you gave
 > sufficient thought to what I was saying.
 > 
 > This new configuration option is a classic example of:
 > https://assafmuller.com/2017/05/19/when-is-not-cool-to-add-a-new-openstack-configuration-option/
 > 
 > We should not add it. We should instead calculate a better value.

Configuration is better than hard coding in most cases, right? Firstly we are impoving the original code here. And I don't think this new option is fully match your blog categories. We do not add or change the driver or architecture here. And this configuration is as simple as enough, users can understand it (maybe I should expand the notes a little more for it). For now, the max value 32 have tested in our local environment. Operators may not be aware of this new option, until their deployment meet the large scale issue or starting storm problem in a very rare case of DVR (plz see the commit message). Then they must take responsibility to learn this new option, and test the value for their own scale and operating pressure. We do not introduce too much head-breaking option for operators. It is very easy to test.

For now I do not change this to calculate the value is because , IMO, it now meets the most zen of the python:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0020/
LOL, : )

Furthermore, the community cannot measure the user deployments and make the choice for them. There are so many composite scenario. Community developers can not learn or test all the cases, but they can narrow down the influences of a new configuration, yeah, which is this patch doing now. And this problem is something like the bug, maybe you can say your code does not bring a bug, but there are new bugs coming out one by one."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-10 10:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/633869/4 : SUCCESS in 1h 34m 16s'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-11 11:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

> > I'm reintroducing my -1 because I don't think that you gave
 > > sufficient thought to what I was saying.
 > >
 > > This new configuration option is a classic example of:
 > > https://assafmuller.com/2017/05/19/when-is-not-cool-to-add-a-new-openstack-configuration-option/
 > >
 > > We should not add it. We should instead calculate a better value.
 > 
 > Configuration is better than hard coding in most cases, right?
 > Firstly we are impoving the original code here. And I don't think
 > this new option is fully match your blog categories. We do not add
 > or change the driver or architecture here. And this configuration
 > is as simple as enough, users can understand it (maybe I should
 > expand the notes a little more for it). For now, the max value 32
 > have tested in our local environment. Operators may not be aware of
 > this new option, until their deployment meet the large scale issue
 > or starting storm problem in a very rare case of DVR (plz see the
 > commit message). Then they must take responsibility to learn this
 > new option, and test the value for their own scale and operating
 > pressure. We do not introduce too much head-breaking option for
 > operators. It is very easy to test.
 > 
 > For now I do not change this to calculate the value is because ,
 > IMO, it now meets the most zen of the python:
 > https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0020/
 > LOL, : )
 > 
 > Furthermore, the community cannot measure the user deployments and
 > make the choice for them. There are so many composite scenario.
 > Community developers can not learn or test all the cases, but they
 > can narrow down the influences of a new configuration, yeah, which
 > is this patch doing now. And this problem is something like the
 > bug, maybe you can say your code does not bring a bug, but there
 > are new bugs coming out one by one.

I basically agree with Assaf here and I think that calculating dynamically size of green pool would be more "elastic" solution.
With config option You basically don't know for sure how much workers You may need in the future and when You hit configured limit, it's already to late - You have an issue in Your cluster. Then You need to change config option and restart agents which will also take long time if You have many routers and instances on host.
Also by config option You force operators to dig into code and check there how this value should be set and this should be IMHO done by us as developers.
So I still think that calculating it as some function of routers would be better idea.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-11 13:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-11 13:15:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

All right, let's give another try."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-02-11 14:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 05:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'Increase l3 router process queue green pool size

There is a race condition between nova-compute boots instance and
l3-agent processes DVR (local) router in compute node. This issue
can be seen when a large number of instances were booted to one
same host, and instances are under different DVR router. So the
l3-agent will concurrently process all these dvr routers in this
host at the same time.
For now we have a green pool for the router ResourceProcessingQueue
with 8 greenlet, but some of these routers can still be waiting, event
worse thing is that there are time-consuming actions during the router
processing procedure. For instance, installing arp entrys, iptables
rules, route rules etc.
So when the VM is up, it will try to get meta via the local proxy
hosting by the dvr router. But the router is not ready yet in that
host. And finally those instances will not be able to setup some
config in the guest OS.

This patch adds a new config with default value 16 (original value
is 8) to indicate the L3 router process queue green pool size.

Related-Bug: #1813787
Change-Id: I62393864a103d666d5d9d379073f5fc23ac7d114

There is a race condition between nova-compute boots instance and

This patch adds a new measurement based on the router quantity to

compute node.

commit_message:
Dynamically increase l3 router process queue green pool size

There is a race condition between nova-compute boots instance and
l3-agent processes DVR (local) router in compute node. This issue
can be seen when a large number of instances were booted to one
same host, and instances are under different DVR router. So the
l3-agent will concurrently process all these dvr routers in this
host at the same time.
For now we have a green pool for the router ResourceProcessingQueue
with 8 greenlet, but some of these routers can still be waiting, event
worse thing is that there are time-consuming actions during the router
processing procedure. For instance, installing arp entries, iptables
rules, route rules etc.
So when the VM is up, it will try to get meta via the local proxy
hosting by the dvr router. But the router is not ready yet in that
host. And finally those instances will not be able to setup some
config in the guest OS.

This patch adds a new measurement based on the router quantity to
indicate the L3 router process queue green pool size. The pool size
will be limit from 8 (original value) to 32, because we do not want
the L3 agent cost too much host resource on processing router in the
compute node.

Related-Bug: #1813787
Change-Id: I62393864a103d666d5d9d379073f5fc23ac7d114

commit_message:
Remove trunk rally scenario from plugins

Since the trunk scenario is now present in rally-openstack
tree, it is no longer needed in neutron tree.

Change-Id: I27c9f0baed267ca8bd181d34842b9d5cc03ab846

[{'created': '2019-02-03 17:35:06.000000000', 'message': 'RbacUtils refactoring part 3 - documentation

commit_message:
Update yappi upper-constraint for version 1.0

yappi 0.99 has a bug[1] that causes OpenStack installation failures
due to it's use in oslo.service. This patch updates the upper-constraint
to allow the release that includes the fix.

[1] https://github.com/sumerc/yappi/commit/ \
    778829f6f77928e4292e6a7dd4dfecf501f9a362

Change-Id: Idac84ffd4149b2448d99ba1432b24e41a1ba606f

commit_message:
Add new owners options to the proxy

We currently have 2 CLI interfaces for generating change owners.
 - owners ; and
 - generate-rolls

And we maintain a shim to translate between calling arguments.  In
I45d6c4d4fd454ae426883006db1e58dbd373bbdf (Support custom local
projects and legacy projects) we added --legacy and --projects to
owners.  This change adds those options to the shim.

Change-Id: Ib38f26744e279f1271679ce1d075ad5a4e3ddb27

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-16 06:54:16.000000000', 'message': "Mark (and use) version with the OSA wrapper script

By doing that, we compute (every bootstrap ansible) the version
of OSA, which is then used in playbooks using an env lookup.

This is faster than doing the lookup pipe of version in the variable, as
this would be computed once, gaining around 0.4s per playbook.
This is about as fast as the current static code, and doesn't
require bumping at every release.

This also allows more flexible releasing (no need to bump metadata here
for a minor bump anymore), as we would have only one source of truth.

Change-Id: I75657c6dae2c6246ec2513f4ec452a4c354d638b
(cherry picked from commit c44fbcbbe3b6d88e9393503e92ac670f9e811148)
(cherry picked from commit a30ce47845039140ecd6def60917207a020c03ea)
(cherry picked from commit 7e0d2e5e5c9cad5be2091d7a973dc2b5abf4d561)
"}]
commit_message:
Mark (and use) version with the OSA wrapper script

By doing that, we compute (every bootstrap ansible) the version
of OSA, which is then used in playbooks using an env lookup.

This is faster than doing the lookup pipe of version in the variable, as
this would be computed once, gaining around 0.4s per playbook.
This is about as fast as the current static code, and doesn't
require bumping at every release.

This also allows more flexible releasing (no need to bump metadata here
for a minor bump anymore), as we would have only one source of truth.

Change-Id: I75657c6dae2c6246ec2513f4ec452a4c354d638b
(cherry picked from commit c44fbcbbe3b6d88e9393503e92ac670f9e811148)
(cherry picked from commit a30ce47845039140ecd6def60917207a020c03ea)
(cherry picked from commit 7e0d2e5e5c9cad5be2091d7a973dc2b5abf4d561)

Don't we need to change http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/policies/credential.py as well to make this effective?"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:08:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> Don't we need to change http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/policies/credential.py
 > as well to make this effective?

Correct, in Rocky the rule is base.ADMIN_REQUIRED, which is https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/common/policies/base.py?h=stable/rocky#n37 . For this fix to work, we would also need to change the rule to something like:

    rule:admin_required or user_id:%(target.credential.user_id)s

Without the check for user_id against target credential's user_id the fix wont actually change if this can function

Guang:

When I was commenting about the policy changes that would not be stable backportable, i was specifically highlighting the SYSTEM_READER type changes, you're still going to need to change the default policies if you're looking to undo the break in behavior."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-02-18 17:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-20 10:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-16 01:27:00.000000000', 'message': 'fix self-service credential APIs

Self-service credential APIs are broken in stable/rocky because
it no longer building the target attributes with the entity
data. Therefore, only "admin" can perform credential optionations.
The lack of self-service capability limits the usefulness of
these APIs. Arguably this is break backward compatibility as
self-service used to work in stable/queens and older releases.
Though we've never built the properly tests to guard this
functionality.

This patch re-enables self-service capability by conveying the
entity data via the target attributes. It also build the proper
tests for it.

Change-Id: Ic7dddc4d2fe7b6c6ae3bf6aed6c4c048743b3eed
Closes-Bug: 1815539
'}]
commit_message:
fix self-service credential APIs

Self-service credential APIs are broken in stable/rocky because
it no longer building the target attributes with the entity
data. Therefore, only "admin" can perform credential optionations.
The lack of self-service capability limits the usefulness of
these APIs. Arguably this is break backward compatibility as
self-service used to work in stable/queens and older releases.
Though we've never built the properly tests to guard this
functionality.

This patch re-enables self-service capability by conveying the
entity data via the target attributes. It also build the proper
tests for it.

Change-Id: Ic7dddc4d2fe7b6c6ae3bf6aed6c4c048743b3eed
Closes-Bug: 1815539

[{'created': '2019-02-16 07:26:54.000000000', 'message': "Mark (and use) version with the OSA wrapper script

By doing that, we compute (every bootstrap ansible) the version
of OSA, which is then used in playbooks using an env lookup.

This is faster than doing the lookup pipe of version in the variable, as
this would be computed once, gaining around 0.4s per playbook.
This is about as fast as the current static code, and doesn't
require bumping at every release.

This also allows more flexible releasing (no need to bump metadata here
for a minor bump anymore), as we would have only one source of truth.

Change-Id: I75657c6dae2c6246ec2513f4ec452a4c354d638b
(cherry picked from commit c44fbcbbe3b6d88e9393503e92ac670f9e811148)
(cherry picked from commit a30ce47845039140ecd6def60917207a020c03ea)
(cherry picked from commit 7e0d2e5e5c9cad5be2091d7a973dc2b5abf4d561)
"}]
commit_message:
Mark (and use) version with the OSA wrapper script

By doing that, we compute (every bootstrap ansible) the version
of OSA, which is then used in playbooks using an env lookup.

This is faster than doing the lookup pipe of version in the variable, as
this would be computed once, gaining around 0.4s per playbook.
This is about as fast as the current static code, and doesn't
require bumping at every release.

This also allows more flexible releasing (no need to bump metadata here
for a minor bump anymore), as we would have only one source of truth.

Change-Id: I75657c6dae2c6246ec2513f4ec452a4c354d638b
(cherry picked from commit c44fbcbbe3b6d88e9393503e92ac670f9e811148)
(cherry picked from commit a30ce47845039140ecd6def60917207a020c03ea)
(cherry picked from commit 7e0d2e5e5c9cad5be2091d7a973dc2b5abf4d561)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-16 07:26:54.000000000', 'message': 'Change the osa wrapper from a heredoc to a file

The environment variable "OSA_WRAPPER_BIN" has been added to the bootstrap
script so that deployers could, if they so choose, override the wrapper
script with something else. While I can't imagine folks needing this all
the time, there have been several occasions where it's been necessary to
augment the wrapper tool locally within an environment. Every-time this has
been needed it creates a maintenance burden on operators over the lifetime
of the deployment and it'd be great if we had an official entry point into
this tooling when needed.

This will be required to simplify the releasing process in the same way
across the branches.

Change-Id: I6a05d3b73838fa646a635831d655f7470df3378f
(cherry picked from commit 2b2447e72d955cf0816d34cac7258fbc11a6d5fb)
(cherry picked from commit ecdd3822b6007eb804d9e3681959cc382859103f)
'}]
commit_message:
Change the osa wrapper from a heredoc to a file

The environment variable "OSA_WRAPPER_BIN" has been added to the bootstrap
script so that deployers could, if they so choose, override the wrapper
script with something else. While I can't imagine folks needing this all
the time, there have been several occasions where it's been necessary to
augment the wrapper tool locally within an environment. Every-time this has
been needed it creates a maintenance burden on operators over the lifetime
of the deployment and it'd be great if we had an official entry point into
this tooling when needed.

This will be required to simplify the releasing process in the same way
across the branches.

Change-Id: I6a05d3b73838fa646a635831d655f7470df3378f
(cherry picked from commit 2b2447e72d955cf0816d34cac7258fbc11a6d5fb)
(cherry picked from commit ecdd3822b6007eb804d9e3681959cc382859103f)

commit_message:
Convert mac to hostname mapping to composable services

Adds a new composable service template at
extraconfig/services/mac-to-hostname-mapping.j2.yaml
which can be used for the same functionality as
extraconfig/all_nodes/mac_hostname.j2.yaml which is now deprecated.

Change-Id: I5922b59ada7e3d3acf76819ebb19583585c5d0ac

commit_message:
Convert Cisco Nexus UCSM to composable service

This adds the new composable service template at
extraconfig/services/neutron-plugin-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.j2.yaml
that refactos the software deployments from
puppet/extraconfig/all_nodes/neutron-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.j2.yaml.
to use the composable services model instead. The extraconfig template
is still needed to write the necessary hiearadata.

It can be enabled with environments/neutron-ml2-cisco-nexus-ucsm.yaml
and adding the OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronCorePluginML2CiscoNexusUCSM
serivce to the roles services list.

Change-Id: I49aee3bba404454f21141835a1dbab8f9bf17b00

[{'created': '2019-02-19 20:54:44.000000000', 'message': 'update pci_passthrough template variables

While it works as is, the output does not match nova docs.
nova_pci_passthrough_whitelist:
    '{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }'
outputting
passthrough_whitelist = "{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }"
instead of the following as expected
passthrough_whitelist = { "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }
same thing happens with the alias lines.  This hits all release back to
at least pike.

Change-Id: I5fc34689eb12e6bd9b4f8977f2b9eebe637f11ec
(cherry picked from commit 4d01d54269609ca96a2f4e4e9893f3980447a67e)
'}]
commit_message:
update pci_passthrough template variables

While it works as is, the output does not match nova docs.
nova_pci_passthrough_whitelist:
    '{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }'
outputting
passthrough_whitelist = "{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }"
instead of the following as expected
passthrough_whitelist = { "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }
same thing happens with the alias lines.  This hits all release back to
at least pike.

Change-Id: I5fc34689eb12e6bd9b4f8977f2b9eebe637f11ec
(cherry picked from commit 4d01d54269609ca96a2f4e4e9893f3980447a67e)

commit_message:
Update devstack to properly configure nova-lxd img

Nova-lxd requires images which are tar.gz. This patch adds functionality to
create this type of image and generates missing directories.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia836cf35e946c2def50081e9348b979fe811b739

commit_message:
Implement new option: default_ephemeral_format

This change implements a new option in config.yaml that sets the
default format for new ephemeral volumes attached to instances.

Closes-Bug: #1693943
Change-Id: Iff9254039fa6f1cef9d80c0d59de8e37b39e30f0

commit_message:
Update env-vars and openrc to use openstack CLI

The ironic CLI is deprecated, and use of OS_AUTH_TOKEN causes problems
when set during deploy-dynamic.yaml, so we should move to recommending
use of the openstack CLI instead.

Change-Id: I7aa969385962008505db3115fc7e86b2729f26ee
Story: 2005034
Task: 29523
(cherry picked from commit 6a0ef585a93fc9405e2befed75fd84001fce690f)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Bump amqp requirement version to >=2.4.1

Bumping the version of amqp in requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt from 2.4.0 to 2.4.1 to mitigate issues with
MessagingTimeouts when using TLS due to a amqp bug that was fixed in
2.4.1

Change-Id: I0b094f32dec24c70f95ccd509164a14a71fcfc7d
Closes-Bug: #1800957

[{'created': '2019-02-18 17:00:59.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify some config options

current help message to log-config-append is a bit misleading:
if the extra logging config is using oslo_log's ContextFormatter
as formatter for some handler, the logging_context_format_string
option and the like to still apply.

Replace the "for example" with log-date-format and clarify that
some options are used with ContextFormatter only.

Change-Id: I917cdf8799ac0fb5b49873d5c7bccd957a42f347
'}, {'created': '2019-02-19 08:28:00.000000000', 'message': "Clarify some config options

current help message to log-config-append is a bit misleading:
if the extra logging config is using oslo_log's ContextFormatter
as formatter for some handler, the logging_context_format_string
option and the like do in fact still apply.

Instead, give the `log-date-format` as example option that does apply
when log-config-append is enabled and clarify that some options
are used with ContextFormatter only.

Change-Id: I917cdf8799ac0fb5b49873d5c7bccd957a42f347
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify some config options

current help message to log-config-append is a bit misleading:
if the extra logging config is using oslo_log's ContextFormatter
as formatter for some handler, the logging_context_format_string
option and the like do in fact still apply.

Instead, give the `log-date-format` as example option that does apply
when log-config-append is enabled and clarify that some options
are used with ContextFormatter only.

Change-Id: I917cdf8799ac0fb5b49873d5c7bccd957a42f347

commit_message:
Fix dev install (yum -y...)

Fixes an issue in 410408ef1b665aab4672d4b3dad2bbc7de543b7d where
we removed the -y options for the pip RPM install. This functionally
broke the dev mode playbook unless you had manually installed pip
in the container (not normally the case for RDO images).

Change-Id: Ic96d9eb708bff763cbe4395cf7770b5239879309
Closes-bug: #1816775

subject: Add postinstall in tox.ini
messages:
[{'account_id': 25740, 'date': '2018-02-07 03:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-02-08 12:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

https://docs.npmjs.com/misc/scripts

postinstall hook should be executed when you run:
npm install

That said, there are a few buggy npm versions where it does not.
Such as 5.3.0, 5.2.0, 5.1.0

So a possible fix is to upgrade your client npm by:
npm install npm@latest -g'}, {'account_id': 25740, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thx Hengqing Hu for the reply. But I already installed the latest version 5.6.0 (No update after run npm install npm@latest -g). I think the postinstall hook is still necessary. Would you please double check it? Thx!'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Paste your
npm version
npm install

Since the ci works before your patch, so npm postinstall hook should be installed.

I also have npm 5.6.0 and it works.

So it might be something wrong elsewhere.'}, {'account_id': 25740, 'date': '2018-02-09 05:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thx! Here it is! http://paste.openstack.org/show/666878/'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-02-09 05:29:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/3497

So the following might help:
npm install --unsafe-perm

Also it is a good practice to not use root user for daily work.'}, {'account_id': 25740, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Hengqing Hu, you are right! I should run ntp install with normal user!'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-02-09 09:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Glad to hear that, so you guys don't use irc?
Maybe we can hangout after spring festival, since we both in Shanghai.
:-D"}, {'account_id': 25740, 'date': '2018-02-10 02:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's great! I have emailed you with my contact info, looking forward to chatting with you offline!"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-02-20 21:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

There has been no activity on this patch in a year, abandoning it. If you wish to continue working on this patch you can restore it.'}]

commit_message:
Add postinstall in tox.ini

Add "npm run postinstall" in tox.ini to prevent errors when
running tox -e karma. The error messages can be found at:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/664442/

Change-Id: Iff30e951b00035b7fae866f7c92e9d2be397484f

commit_message:
Deprecated error method

$http's deprecated custom callback method: .error() has been
removed in AngularJS 1.6. Use the standard .catch() promise
method instead.

Change-Id: Icaa5afa5da0207029e7a43f95cca15a4188964f7

commit_message:
Add neutron_user_pip_packages variable

With this variable, users would be able to extend
the list of pip packages in case of needing an
extra pip package.

Currently if we need an extra pip package we need
to override the existing list.

Change-Id: If5c860b52af592629317def2c9c21f166a9c6ed1

commit_message:
Update env-vars and openrc to use openstack CLI

The ironic CLI is deprecated, and use of OS_AUTH_TOKEN causes problems
when set during deploy-dynamic.yaml, so we should move to recommending
use of the openstack CLI instead.

Change-Id: I7aa969385962008505db3115fc7e86b2729f26ee
Story: 2005034
Task: 29523

commit_message:
VNX Driver: delete_hba() instead of remove_hba()

The storops drivers doesn't have a remove_hba() function,
it's called delete_hba(). The confusion comes from the fact
that storops uses -removeHBA argument when calling
naviseccli.

Change-Id: I3f72481442436ddf78c10ab53c161663b05a330a
Closes-bug: #1813525
(cherry picked from commit 6145f8583ad1b1b5c631534b1dc05d8bf89c330e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 12:28:56.000000000', 'message': 'Improve error handling for ChassisMetadataAgentEvent

The ChassisMetadataAgentEvent class is suppose to handle events which
are triggered when a Chassis entry is created or updated in the OVSDB.
Prior to this patch, it was assumed that the external_ids column of that
class would contain the "neutron:ovn-metadata-sb-cfg" key in it which is
not always true.

This patch is fixing the problem by handling the case which that key is
not yet present in the Chassis external_ids column.

Change-Id: Ie7f348a70a6f0c67f1822f73e0c559eac46b18bb
Closes-Bug: #1816033
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-02-15 13:31:34.000000000', 'message': 'Improve error handling for ChassisMetadataAgentEvent

The ChassisMetadataAgentEvent class is suppose to handle events which
are triggered when a Chassis entry is created or updated in the OVSDB.
Prior to this patch, it was assumed that the external_ids column of that
class would contain the "neutron:ovn-metadata-sb-cfg" key in it which is
not always true.

This patch is fixing the problem by handling the case which that key is
not yet present in the Chassis external_ids column.

Change-Id: Ie7f348a70a6f0c67f1822f73e0c559eac46b18bb

commit_message:
Improve error handling for ChassisMetadataAgentEvent

The ChassisMetadataAgentEvent class is suppose to handle events which
are triggered when a Chassis entry is created or updated in the OVSDB.
Prior to this patch, it was assumed that the external_ids column of that
entry would contain the "neutron:ovn-metadata-sb-cfg" key in it which is
not always true.

This patch is fixing the problem by handling the case which that key is
not yet present in the Chassis external_ids column.

The patch also prevent the ChassisMetadataAgentEvent from running by
not adding it to the list of events to watch in case the OVN metadata
is not enabled.

Change-Id: Ie7f348a70a6f0c67f1822f73e0c559eac46b18bb
Closes-Bug: #1816033
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Do not use oslo.policy 1.43.1

By the looks of it, the deepcopy of the target introduced in
oslo.policy 1.43.1 is triggering infinite loop on some nested proxy
objects in Glance. Lets not use it for now until we figure out how
to work around this so we get the gate unblocked.

Change-Id: I3a674f2bbb7a72048aa80d61331d21c5548d67b6
related-bug: 1808063

subject: [WIP]: Calcio: Implement pod Security Context as non-root user
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 19:14:04.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]: Calcio: Implement pod Security Context as non-root user

Implement pod Security Context for running containers as non-root user.
Ensure that following Calico pods are using a common security context for
running containers so that they can be run as non-root user.

1. daemonset-calico-etcd.yaml
2. daemonset-calico-node.yaml
3. deployment-calico-kube-controllers.yaml
4. job-calico-settings.yaml

Change-Id: Ibba8b86f45823756feb9afff3d9c7e655bd0deb8
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP]: Calcio: Implement pod Security Context as non-root user

Implement pod Security Context for running containers as non-root user.
Ensure that following Calico pods are using a common security context for
running containers so that they can be run as non-root user.

1. daemonset-calico-etcd.yaml
2. daemonset-calico-node.yaml
3. deployment-calico-kube-controllers.yaml
4. job-calico-settings.yaml

Change-Id: Ibba8b86f45823756feb9afff3d9c7e655bd0deb8

commit_message:
flatten collectd service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration.

Change-Id: I64fc4aae0bfe41f3b9467ab497c79a52aefe5acf

in the ceilometer-agent-notification if panko
is disabled.

Remove ties between ceilometer and panko

Avoid panko related kolla configurations
in the ceilometer-agent-notification if panko
is disabled.

commit_message:
speedup: drop apt pinning dependency

We don't pin anything for memcache so we're just running things
for no reason.

Change-Id: I3a518204a28307cc9f8db593e3117933112a8410

commit_message:
WIP: Cross-cell resize

TODO:

- split out more code:
  - the compute changes; maybe start with check_can_cross_cell_resize
  - the api changes
    - maybe move the policy check to the API and do rpc cast
  - the conductor changes
    - this can probably be further broken down, maybe start with
      a shell task for the resize and then fill it in, add confirm
      in the API and then add revert after that
- shore up the todos/fixmes within the poc
- more test scenario coverage

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: Ib5a1e568d5d343bf0f8b150c0210a24a576fa86a

commit_message:

commit_message:
[pylint] Remove lint tox environment

We don't use the tools/lintstack.py
script anymore since its removal in [1],
so cleanup the unused tox environment and
the gitignore corresponding files.

TrivialFix

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609791/
Change-Id: Id2d40c1f9f1ce71a22ba9836b90c3e917171a556

E402 module level import not at top of file

pep8 must be fixed'}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2018-12-30 13:14:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2018-12-30 13:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-01-15 16:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

IMHO we should add W503 to the ignore setting in the tox.ini file since PEP8 clearly states line breaks *before* the binary operator are preferred.

Ben what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2019-01-16 15:23:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

pep8 still need be fix http://logs.openstack.org/62/627662/3/check/openstack-tox-pep8/1e51d6e/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-12-30_13_25_11_233200'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-16 17:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

We shouldn't change the eventlet monkey patching. That one's important even if it violates pep8.

Otherwise, I'm totally fine ignoring all of the new rules and fixing them in separate patches if we want. Some of these have dubious value IMHO so I'm not sure they're worth "fixing" at all. Also, that would allow us to keep the size of these patches smaller and hopefully avoid bugs because a reviewer's eyes glazed over after looking at the 37th whitespace-only change. :-)'}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2019-02-13 07:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

the other Cinder projects and migrate them all to storyboard later on.

commit_message:
Add python3 packages to overrides (package-replacement)

This change is to be used if kolla accepts the package-replacement
cli option.  The package-replacement option will parse the package lists
after the add/removes so we don't need to switch the appends/removals to
handle the python3 package names because we would be using the same
package names. The problem with this implementation is how we manage
python2/python3 switched later.

Conflicts-With: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629679/
Change-Id: I1021ce09f33cf73e036e16b734099539c84aa9c8
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636457/

commit_message:
Add python3 packages for RHEL systems and non-voting fedora job (packages-replacement)

RDO is currently working on python3 support for the next version of
CentOS/RHEL based systems.  This package uses the distro_python3 flag
that was added as part of I4028991bad92c0e8e21066cc4173c06ce5eba393 to
use the python3 specific package names.  Additionally this change adds a
package replacement file that can be used to swap out the python2
packages for the python3 equivalents. This is an alternative to managing
the package names in the Dockerfiles from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632156/

Change-Id: I18b475bb9e50e10b6d1142a94ee948a41ab0ff8b
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 17:28:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix validation of required services

Cinder team decided to remove Cinder V1 (which is ok since they already
have V3 API) but our logic of required_service validator was not ready
for such step.

This patch includes the next changes of the validaotr:

* Check for nova-network before initializing clients. This is a simple
  check which does not require initialized clients. Since the keystone
  token is fetched while initializing clients, it can be time wasting.
  Also, it is time to fail on this check.

* In case of NotFound error while direct search by service type, use the
  default one
  NOTE: actually, the default service type should be the same as  what
        we have in consts file...

Change-Id: I2018a9b9323cce05ee226fefdc3fe50c356aed9a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix validation of required services

Cinder team decided to remove Cinder V1 (which is ok since they already
have V3 API) but our logic of required_service validator was not ready
for such step.

This patch includes the next changes of the validaotr:

* Check for nova-network before initializing clients. This is a simple
  check which does not require initialized clients. Since the keystone
  token is fetched while initializing clients, it can be time wasting.
  Also, it is time to fail on this check.

* In case of NotFound error while direct search by service type, use the
  default one
  NOTE: actually, the default service type should be the same as  what
        we have in consts file...

Change-Id: I2018a9b9323cce05ee226fefdc3fe50c356aed9a

FibreChannelConnectorTestCase was taking over 6 seconds to complete
since the FixedIntervalLoopingCall in the method under test was not

commit_message:
Make sure looping calls are properly mocked

The test test_connect_volume_device_not_valid in
FibreChannelConnectorTestCase was taking over 6 seconds to complete
since the FixedIntervalLoopingCall in the method under test was not
being mocked out, making the test hang until the timeout was reached.

This fixes this and any other connector test case by moving the mocking
with a test fake into the base connector test class setUp call.

Change-Id: I6b174d94b5518d6267c1fa75528a90d95a312419
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove neutron_lib.db from db profiling projects

All db calls which are tracked by osprofiler are comming from
neutron and there is no need to enable sqlalchemy profiling for
both of them as this results in duplicated sql calls in osprofiler
reports.

commit_message:
Ensure kuryr-controller recover from lb in ERROR status

This patch ensures kuryr controller can recover from the situation
when the created lb goes into ERROR status (instead of ACTIVE). Now,
when the kuryr-controller finds the created lb, it checks its
provisioning_status and if in ERROR status it will delete it and
ensure a ResourceNotReady exception is triggered so that a new
creation action is triggered after the deletion of the lb in ERROR
status.

Closes-Bug: 1815880
Change-Id: I3f5de710a5ff37dee05f5f8826cb37c343141a08
(cherry picked from commit 33594b870297aa88f15d73c221b6aa04709afe6d)

commit_message:
Ensure kuryr-controller recover from lb in ERROR status

This patch ensures kuryr controller can recover from the situation
when the created lb goes into ERROR status (instead of ACTIVE). Now,
when the kuryr-controller finds the created lb, it checks its
provisioning_status and if in ERROR status it will delete it and
ensure a ResourceNotReady exception is triggered so that a new
creation action is triggered after the deletion of the lb in ERROR
status.

Closes-Bug: 1815880
Change-Id: I3f5de710a5ff37dee05f5f8826cb37c343141a08
(cherry picked from commit 33594b870297aa88f15d73c221b6aa04709afe6d)

[{'created': '2019-02-13 10:53:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix CRD podSelector update

When the podSelector of a NP is updated, the podSelector
on the respective CRD must also be updated with the same
values. However, this field is not being properly updated.
This commit fixes the issue by changing the merge strategy to
JSON Patch, instead of JSON Merge Patch.

TODO:
- Improve commit message and bug description

Change-Id: Ic629c1ba4ac13c2bfaffdf7f904b69abf9521ed3
Closes-Bug: 1810394
'}, {'created': '2019-02-14 13:31:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix CRD podSelector update

When the podSelector of a NP is updated, the podSelector
on the respective CRD must also be updated with the same
value. However, this do not happen in case the field of a label
is updated, for example: Label {'app: demo'} is updated to
{'context:demo'} the result given is {'app: demo', 'context:demo'}
when should be {'context:demo'}. And after that, if the updated label
{'context:demo'} is removed from the NP, it will not be removed from the CRD.
These cases happen because the podSelector field is a dict and not
a list.

This commit fixes the issue by changing the merge strategy to
JSON Patch, instead of JSON Merge Patch.

Change-Id: Ic629c1ba4ac13c2bfaffdf7f904b69abf9521ed3
Closes-Bug: 1810394

commit_message:
Fix CRD podSelector update

When the podSelector of a NP is updated, the podSelector
on the respective CRD must also be updated with the same
value. However, this do not happen in case the field of a label
is updated, for example: Label {'app: demo'} is updated to
{'context:demo'} the result given is {'app: demo', 'context:demo'}
when should be {'context:demo'}. And after that, if the updated label
{'context:demo'} is removed from the NP, it will not be removed from the CRD.
These cases happen because the podSelector field is a dict and not
a list.

This commit fixes the issue by changing the merge strategy to
JSON Patch, instead of JSON Merge Patch.

Change-Id: Ic629c1ba4ac13c2bfaffdf7f904b69abf9521ed3
Closes-Bug: 1810394

commit_message:
Handle None value 'inititator_target_map'

Should check not only if 'initiator_target_map' is in conn_props but
also its value is not None.

Change-Id: I7ca0bf5fac20a370097f1c39ce005a1b23814459
Closes-Bug: #1746218

commit_message:
Add 'unknown' to the address list if the port's port security is disabled

When a port's port security is disabled then the port should be allowed to use
any mac address. And for this to work, OVN expects 'unknown' address
to be added into the Logical_Switch_Port.addresses column. This patch
adds this 'unknown' address if the port security is disabled.

Change-Id: I5f25f4d4b2acccada3ab2944e9cfd2461149ef3e
Closes-bug: #1815270
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-01 23:05:07.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Detach backing vmdk during disconnect

During restore, the backing vmdk is overwritten using backup
data. If the restored vmdk has a different uuid or size than the
original one, it will not be reflected in vSphere. Due to this
stale metadata, there is no way we can fix the uuid or backing
vmdk size if it changes after restore. The recommended way is to
detach the backing vmdk from the backend volume (shadow VM),
delete it and attach the restored vmdk. This will ensure update
of current vmdk size and uuid in vSphere.

Change-Id: Ib3d5c115f9076c19c3e33eaf6cccf630439a4c26
Partial-bug: 1814346
Partial-bug: 1814347
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Detach backing vmdk during disconnect

During restore, the backing vmdk is overwritten using backup
data. If the restored vmdk has a different uuid or size than the
original one, it will not be reflected in vSphere. Due to this
stale metadata, there is no way we can fix the uuid or backing
vmdk size if it changes after restore. The recommended way is to
detach the backing vmdk from the backend volume (shadow VM),
delete it and attach the restored vmdk. This will ensure update
of current vmdk size and uuid in vSphere.

Change-Id: Ib3d5c115f9076c19c3e33eaf6cccf630439a4c26
Partial-bug: 1814346
Partial-bug: 1814347

subject: cinder.conf: add [nova] section, override interface defaults
messages: [{'account_id': 2463, 'date': '2019-02-15 14:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2019-02-20 12:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-02-20 13:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-02-20 14:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 14:56:32.000000000', 'message': 'cinder.conf: add [nova] section, override interface defaults

To the best of my knowledge, the [nova] section in cinder.conf
is only ever used if the Cinder scheduler is acting as a Nova client
when the operator has enabled the InstanceLocalityFilter.

Per https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/configuration/block-storage/samples/cinder.conf.html,
Cinder defaults to using the public Nova endpoint when using the
Nova API. This is contrary to OSA precedent, where services
normally use internal endpoints for service-to-service API requests.

When enabling the InstanceLocalityFilter in combination with Cinder
talking to the public Nova endpoint, this can create a very confusing
situation, particularly in pre-production clusters: if the public
endpoint has a self-signed SSL certificate, and Cinder is not
explicitly configured not to verify certificates, then this creates
a whole load of connection errors.

Thus, in order to follow POLA, configure the [nova] section to use
the internal endpoint, and (in case the internal endpoint does
use HTTPS) honor the keystone_service_internaluri_insecure setting,
as for other services.

Change-Id: Ie31a7e2917a188027db49ac51e6a77ee39a9abf0
'}]
commit_message:
cinder.conf: add [nova] section, override interface defaults

To the best of my knowledge, the [nova] section in cinder.conf
is only ever used if the Cinder scheduler is acting as a Nova client
when the operator has enabled the InstanceLocalityFilter.

Per https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/configuration/block-storage/samples/cinder.conf.html,
Cinder defaults to using the public Nova endpoint when using the
Nova API. This is contrary to OSA precedent, where services
normally use internal endpoints for service-to-service API requests.

When enabling the InstanceLocalityFilter in combination with Cinder
talking to the public Nova endpoint, this can create a very confusing
situation, particularly in pre-production clusters: if the public
endpoint has a self-signed SSL certificate, and Cinder is not
explicitly configured not to verify certificates, then this creates
a whole load of connection errors.

Thus, in order to follow POLA, configure the [nova] section to use
the internal endpoint, and (in case the internal endpoint does
use HTTPS) honor the keystone_service_internaluri_insecure setting,
as for other services.

Change-Id: Ie31a7e2917a188027db49ac51e6a77ee39a9abf0
