commit_message:
Rehome base upgrade checks class

Class neutron.cmd.upgrade_checks.base.BaseChecks can be
used as base class for upgrade checks implemented in stadium
or 3rd party projects (e.g. in [1]).
It will be better to have it in neutron-lib rather than in
neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637203/

Change-Id: I6f9777358a33444fabd09e611a9cddd807827573

subject: Add policy module to neutron-lib
messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-12 22:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-02-13 13:37:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

So we already have the policy module in neutron [1], but it's private because it's never been formalized. Shouldn't we be looking at formalizing [1] with the code herein rather than adding another policy module??


[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/_policy.py"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-18 05:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Slawek, thanks for taking care of this.

When I tried to add these to neutron-lib (locally), I hit the same problem as Boden pointed out. We already have _policy.py module, so it can be confusing to add a new policy.py.

Let's check the role of these two files,
- (existing) _policy.py provides: a policy engine implementation for internal use of neutron-lib (i.e., context.py only currently)
- (proposed) policy.py provides common definitions for the neutron stadium/3rd party projects.

Considering this, how about the following?

- Create a new directory "policy"
- Add a new file policy/__init__.py (to provide definitions added by this patch)
- Move _policy.py to policy/_engine.py (the filename starts with underscore to clarify the internal use)

At least I believe we can avoid two similar files at the top directory.

Thought?'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-02-18 08:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-18 10:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-18 10:32:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Slawek, thanks for taking care of this.
 > 
 > When I tried to add these to neutron-lib (locally), I hit the same
 > problem as Boden pointed out. We already have _policy.py module, so
 > it can be confusing to add a new policy.py.
 > 
 > Let's check the role of these two files,
 > - (existing) _policy.py provides: a policy engine implementation
 > for internal use of neutron-lib (i.e., context.py only currently)
 > - (proposed) policy.py provides common definitions for the neutron
 > stadium/3rd party projects.
 > 
 > Considering this, how about the following?
 > 
 > - Create a new directory "policy"
 > - Add a new file policy/__init__.py (to provide definitions added
 > by this patch)
 > - Move _policy.py to policy/_engine.py (the filename starts with
 > underscore to clarify the internal use)
 > 
 > At least I believe we can avoid two similar files at the top
 > directory.
 > 
 > Thought?

I like this suggestions. Done :)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-19 06:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-19 08:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-02-19 08:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add policy module to neutron-lib

This module contains some constants and helper functions
which may be used in neutron, neutron staduim and neutron
3rd party projects.

Also already existing module _policy with policy engine
implementation for internal use of neutron-lib for moved to
the new neutron_lib.policy module and is now named
neutron_lib.policy._engine

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-policy-in-code

Change-Id: Ie581788f78f6d83ae470981830df9e90a7cb72e8

commit_message:
Introduce cinder_scheduler_default_filters

Operators may want to define specific default filters. Previously,
they could only do so via cinder_cinder_conf_overrides.

Make the cinder.conf template understand cinder_scheduler_default_filters,
a list variable that, if defined, is folded into a comma-separated
list for scheduler_default_filters in the [DEFAULT] section.

Change-Id: I12859167d19b9f40e3378ac08fed094a42f40bc7

commit_message:
nova_libvirt_init_secret: add net=host

Required by podman to create the virsh secrets.
Somehow it was hidden by podman.

commit_message:
Add missing undercloud_conf parameters.

The undercloud upgrades job was missing the cloud_domain and
undercloud_hostname parameters, which made the job fail now
that the undercloud hostname is being verified to be qualified [0].

[0] - 63f4175e768796970801a36dee9585b3d89a9531

Change-Id: Ib4b19dc8e6674dcd564d6f3fed66f8efd907e927
Closes-Bug: #1816720

commit_message:
undercloud: configure ContainerImagePrepareDebug based on undercloud_debug

Instead of creating a new undercloud.conf parameter to enable the debug
on Container Image Prepare task, let's recycle undercloud_debug.

Depends-On: I7d0b4035de748bf2453321d3ab09d09fd45abf8d

Change-Id: I15d910a53a34d4ac09b2728317506ee0edf981f2

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for neutron dhcpd

The default procedure wasn't working, here we set one that will actually work.

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Depends-On: I9954cf33efedf2ec3dfb03109595cd4431feff60
Change-Id: I449df13ea2c49a8cf6d2e8e632b2b39707071c52
(cherry picked from commit ce1e7eafe6e02f985ed2a72023637453aaa13c10)

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 09:50:05.000000000', 'message': 'TLS everywhere: Mount the whole /etc/pki/libvirt/ directory in libvirt

We need to mount the whole directory inside the libvirt container,
so that when new certificates are generated, they could be accessed from
within the container.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3f1e7511d56f9a974409a9a1e3ed66ba8fa72e36

We need to mount the whole directory inside the libvirt container,
so that when new certificates are generated, they could be accessed from
within the container.

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Mount the whole /etc/pki/libvirt/ directory in libvirt

We need to mount the whole directory inside the libvirt container,
so that when new certificates are generated, they could be accessed from
within the container.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3f1e7511d56f9a974409a9a1e3ed66ba8fa72e36
(cherry picked from commit fff1df6ee07a49090e7269d3d2bc1f998d846044)

commit_message:
Allocation API: resume allocations on conductor restart

This change allows allocations that were not finished because of
conductor restarting or crashing to be finished after start up.

Change-Id: I016e08dcb59613b59ae753ef7d3bc9ac4a4a950a
Story: #2004341
Task: #29544

commit_message:
Set tempest_private_net_provider_type to geneve for os_tempest

In tripleo, due to ovn migration in tripleo, vxlan does not
work, we need to switch to geneve for private
network type provider.

Change-Id: Iec87c79b0ab503f38cdde744c440a551f3e3ec35
Closes-Bug: #1816552

commit_message:
Set tempest_private_net_provider_type to geneve as default

Since most of the places OVN is used as the default ML2
driver and vxlan is not supported by OVN, so we are making
geneve as a default here.

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/
tree/tests/neutron-overrides-ovn.yml

Change-Id: I0a674687858e58e594d31f170f507b8b4fe14290

through Horizon.

[{'created': '2019-02-16 07:19:06.000000000', 'message': "Mark (and use) version with the OSA wrapper script

By doing that, we compute (every bootstrap ansible) the version
of OSA, which is then used in playbooks using an env lookup.

This is faster than doing the lookup pipe of version in the variable, as
this would be computed once, gaining around 0.4s per playbook.

Change-Id: I75657c6dae2c6246ec2513f4ec452a4c354d638b
(cherry picked from commit c44fbcbbe3b6d88e9393503e92ac670f9e811148)

commit_message:
Mark (and use) version with the OSA wrapper script

By doing that, we compute (every bootstrap ansible) the version
of OSA, which is then used in playbooks using an env lookup.

This is faster than doing the lookup pipe of version in the variable, as
this would be computed once, gaining around 0.4s per playbook.
This is about as fast as the current static code, and doesn't
require bumping at every release.

This also allows more flexible releasing (no need to bump metadata here
for a minor bump anymore), as we would have only one source of truth.

Change-Id: I75657c6dae2c6246ec2513f4ec452a4c354d638b
(cherry picked from commit c44fbcbbe3b6d88e9393503e92ac670f9e811148)
(cherry picked from commit a30ce47845039140ecd6def60917207a020c03ea)
(cherry picked from commit 7e0d2e5e5c9cad5be2091d7a973dc2b5abf4d561)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-16 07:19:06.000000000', 'message': 'Change the osa wrapper from a heredoc to a file

The environment variable "OSA_WRAPPER_BIN" has been added to the bootstrap
script so that deployers could, if they so choose, override the wrapper
script with something else. While I can't imagine folks needing this all
the time, there have been several occasions where it's been necessary to
augment the wrapper tool locally within an environment. Every-time this has
been needed it creates a maintenance burden on operators over the lifetime
of the deployment and it'd be great if we had an official entry point into
this tooling when needed.

This will be required to simplify the releasing process in the same way
across the branches.

Change-Id: I6a05d3b73838fa646a635831d655f7470df3378f
(cherry picked from commit 2b2447e72d955cf0816d34cac7258fbc11a6d5fb)
(cherry picked from commit ecdd3822b6007eb804d9e3681959cc382859103f)
'}]
commit_message:
Change the osa wrapper from a heredoc to a file

The environment variable "OSA_WRAPPER_BIN" has been added to the bootstrap
script so that deployers could, if they so choose, override the wrapper
script with something else. While I can't imagine folks needing this all
the time, there have been several occasions where it's been necessary to
augment the wrapper tool locally within an environment. Every-time this has
been needed it creates a maintenance burden on operators over the lifetime
of the deployment and it'd be great if we had an official entry point into
this tooling when needed.

This will be required to simplify the releasing process in the same way
across the branches.

Change-Id: I6a05d3b73838fa646a635831d655f7470df3378f
(cherry picked from commit 2b2447e72d955cf0816d34cac7258fbc11a6d5fb)
(cherry picked from commit ecdd3822b6007eb804d9e3681959cc382859103f)

LGTM. Let's get Melanie's +1 on this before we proceed, but I don't have any issues with it."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-12 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2019-02-12 19:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:02:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:16:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

FWIW I'm OK with this plan. The tags need to be updated but I guess that can be a follow up change. The two major things to get done for the governance switch where deployment tool support and the reshaper changes. TripleO has deployment changes up for review and will not get upgrades done in Stein which is why we're leaving the (frozen) placement code in nova to ease the upgrade and migration in Train. OSC is also working on deployment tooling with extracted placement in Stein (Kolla as well I think). Since we're not deleting the placement-in-nova code in Stein I think the deployment tools + upgrade support requirement for the governance split can be relaxed here. As for the reshaper stuff, the libvirt driver change [1] is being worked, albeit slowly. The xenapi driver change is essentially abandoned [2] due to the owner leaving Citrix.

I think at this point we clearly have a different operating (sub)team that should be allowed to govern themselves and have a PTL election for Train.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/599208/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520313/"}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:32:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I can't speak to the correctness of all the yamlisms, but I'm supportive of this being appropriate timing for a governance split."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Yep, as I understand it, we need this before Train so that there is a Stein release as a bridge'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-12 20:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-12 22:44:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1

I considered recusing myself but then decided I'd rather not.

I agree that we should explore adjusting the tags in a followup, perhaps once Train opens."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-02-13 01:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1

lgtm. waiting for melwitt +1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-13 01:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-13 14:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Rollcall-Vote+1

As far as I can tell this has clear support from the contributors involved, and the project meets the requirements for new teams. We're in the process of moving the deadline for building the voting rolls (https://review.openstack.org/636510) so that Placement will be able to participate in the upcoming PTL election for Train (rather than requiring a special election of some sort)."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-13 14:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This change can be approved on 2019-02-20'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:04:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

We accomplished most of the agreed criteria for the project split [1] during the cycle, with the exception of deployment tools upgrade support, but since we changed the plan and are leaving the nova placement code in place until Train, that provides a bridge release for deployment tools and operators to deal with the upgrade and data migration.

The libvirt nested reshaper patch is actively being worked on, a functional test for reshaping has been written, and reshaping has been lab tested with real hardware to ensure that a reshape works and that new requests for vGPU after a reshape work as well.

Given the progress that's been made, I think we are OK to go ahead with creation of the separate project.

commit_message:
Create separate Placement project

This patch formally creates a separate Placement project. It started out
as a sub-project of Nova, but the plan all along was to eventually have
it exist on its own.

Change-Id: I53be2614fe19aa27f47a1dd9901a21d691386db6

commit_message:
Remove upgrade_tasks added during nova services flattening.

During some of the nova service flattening it was included some of the
baremetal upgrade_tasks into the containerized services. This patch removes
them.

Change-Id: I4a569195deeadb34180561c778dabe77be4f6466
Closes-Bug: #1816453

commit_message:
Adding scenario012 standalone job

Added standalone job to test ironic using scenario012. Uses
featureset060 and overrides tempest test to run only the ones relevant
to ironic.

Change-Id: I28fc3f9bcb74299b92c47340a541284b9084f6a9
Depends-On: I308f569f41fc1a1c18ad543cf23db4672a3b5eb9

commit_message:
Fix unbound "mac" variable

There's a DEBUG trace which is using a non existent variable in
that scope and that caused a failure when DEBUG level was enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1816031
Change-Id: I6c77623bd199bcbb3f4ad46a7fee3b2fac325790
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 20:52:31.000000000', 'message': 'update pci_passthrough template variables

While it works as is, the output does not match nova docs.
nova_pci_passthrough_whitelist:
    '{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }'
outputting
passthrough_whitelist = "{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }"
instead of the following as expected
passthrough_whitelist = { "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }
same thing happens with the alias lines.  This hits all release back to
at least pike.

Change-Id: I5fc34689eb12e6bd9b4f8977f2b9eebe637f11ec
(cherry picked from commit 4d01d54269609ca96a2f4e4e9893f3980447a67e)
'}]
commit_message:
update pci_passthrough template variables

While it works as is, the output does not match nova docs.
nova_pci_passthrough_whitelist:
    '{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }'
outputting
passthrough_whitelist = "{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }"
instead of the following as expected
passthrough_whitelist = { "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }
same thing happens with the alias lines.  This hits all release back to
at least pike.

Change-Id: I5fc34689eb12e6bd9b4f8977f2b9eebe637f11ec
(cherry picked from commit 4d01d54269609ca96a2f4e4e9893f3980447a67e)

commit_message:
Correct the use of assertTrue

If the first argument of assertTrue is True, the assertion
will always pass. This patch fixes this which makes the
comment gievn for the code reasonable.

Change-Id: Ief4643a18c64854989e03441145c5a723684f067

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 20:56:19.000000000', 'message': 'update pci_passthrough template variables

While it works as is, the output does not match nova docs.
nova_pci_passthrough_whitelist:
    '{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }'
outputting
passthrough_whitelist = "{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }"
instead of the following as expected
passthrough_whitelist = { "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }
same thing happens with the alias lines.  This hits all release back to
at least pike.

Change-Id: I5fc34689eb12e6bd9b4f8977f2b9eebe637f11ec
(cherry picked from commit 4d01d54269609ca96a2f4e4e9893f3980447a67e)
'}]
commit_message:
update pci_passthrough template variables

While it works as is, the output does not match nova docs.
nova_pci_passthrough_whitelist:
    '{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }'
outputting
passthrough_whitelist = "{ "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }"
instead of the following as expected
passthrough_whitelist = { "vendor_id": "10de", "product_id": "15f7" }
same thing happens with the alias lines.  This hits all release back to
at least pike.

Change-Id: I5fc34689eb12e6bd9b4f8977f2b9eebe637f11ec
(cherry picked from commit 4d01d54269609ca96a2f4e4e9893f3980447a67e)

commit_message:
[k8s] Add trustee as a secret in kube-system

Add a new secret in kube-system holding the trustee information. This is
useful for any service running within kubernetes needing to contact
OpenStack services.

Change-Id: I1939fb6a33c9eb6a45697d070f58c9510be774b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 09:11:12.000000000', 'message': "Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change exposes the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option for TripleO deployment. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Change-Id: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72
"}, {'created': '2019-02-14 08:46:17.000000000', 'message': "Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change exposes the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option for TripleO deployment. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Change-Id: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72
"}]
commit_message:
Fail to live migration if instance has NUMA topology

Live migration is currently totally broken if a NUMA topology is
present. This affects everything that's been regrettably stuffed in with
NUMA topology including CPU pinning, hugepage support and emulator
thread support. Side effects can range from simple unexpected
performance hits (due to instances running on the same cores) to
complete failures (due to instance cores or huge pages being mapped to
CPUs/NUMA nodes that don't exist on the destination host).

Until such a time as we resolve these issues, we should alert users to
the fact that such issues exist. A workaround option is provided for
operators that _really_ need the broken behavior, but it's defaulted to
False to highlight the brokenness of this feature to unsuspecting
operators.

The related nova change is I217fba9138132b107e9d62895d699d238392e761

The proposed change exposes the 'enable_numa_live_migration'
workarounds option for TripleO deployment. By default this feature will be
disabled for NUMA topology instances.

Change-Id: I16794fbfef0e6e83d3fcebb9e6bc2fcf478ebf72

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2017-01-23 16:42:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Yushiro. So eventually our intent on a rule is to either specify TCP or UDP (our most common cases) _or_ we can specify an 8 bit integer for protocol _or_ the protocol is a don't care (any). Then there is the default value. Maybe we can discuss this a bit more ?"}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2017-01-23 16:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Temporary -1 for the clarification - I am ok if we go with this and then we can do a follow up if required.'}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2017-01-24 02:53:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> our intent on a rule is to either specify 
>a)TCP or UDP 
>b)specify an 8 bit integer for protocol 
>c)the protocol is a don't care (any). Then there is the default value. 
I think the above covers the basoc Use Case as most Firewalling would be done wrt ICMP, TCP and UDP
User can add IGMP and other type of rules using Protocol Numbers, though, he should know which number corresponds to which Protocol ( RFC related to that protocol numbering should ideally be notified to the users, specially those who do not have a clue about it )

I am a bit skeptical about ANY though, while writing this up.
What do we mean by ANY in a firewall rule. Does it mean only a specific protocol, or ALL protocols.
The reason why I am stating this is, a user would ideally not want just ANY type of firewall . If they are creating a firewall rule, then they would like it to do something or the other, and ANY gives an access to kind of block a bigger chunk of protocols.
Anyways, thats IMHO"}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2017-01-25 00:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2017-01-25 00:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To Sridar:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424716/  has been merged.  Hence, we can specify 8bit digit as 'protocol'  in REST API call directly.

To Reedip:

>a)TCP or UDP

No.  It should be 'tcp' or 'udp' or 'icmp'.

>he should know which number corresponds to which Protocol 
Agree.  We should add this help into API reference.  In addition,  we should expand OSC plugin to be able to specify 8bit digit as 'protocol'.
As Sridar said, 'ANY' is equal to 'don't care a protocol'."}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2017-01-25 12:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-25 15:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Fix validation with 'protocol' for firewall_rule

This commit fixes an error message with following create/update cases:
and source/destination ports for firewall_rule create/update. Then, it
raises FirewallRuleWithPortWithoutProtocolInvalid.

  * Try to create with no 'protocol' and source/destination ports
  * Try to update 'protocol' to "None" and existing rule has
    source/destination ports.
  * Try to update source/destination ports and existing rule has no
    'protocol'("None" specified).

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee<reedip.banerjee@nectechnologies.in>
Change-Id: I7a738d39d7e0e79631cf4f0886727920c220bd4b
Closes-Bug: #1657182

commit_message:
Do not raise StopIteration

The current code will not work in Python3.7 because of PEP479. This
commit fixes it so that it works with both 3.6 and 3.7.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0479/

Closes-bug: #1815335
Change-Id: I6adf23e0569db8655806a07d53c5000f5fd0918f

commit_message:
Add load balancer flavor support to the OSC client

This patch adds the flavor fields for load balancers.

It also adds .stestr to the .gitigonre list.

Change-Id: I9153895eb5e7ebba50a2c31b5375ecf173d8bfa2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 12:06:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix help message of image add project

Only with the admin role you can use the project name with
'image add project'. With the normal member role you have to
use the project id instead. If you try to use the name, you
don't receive an error, but it won't work.

Change-Id: I2d11c07a256917d12c46a7c302c5a5e8752a1df0
Task: 29543
Story: 2002535

commit_message:
Fix help message of image add project

Only with the admin role you can use the project name with
'image add project'. With the normal member role you have to
use the project id instead. If you try to use the name, you
don't receive an error, but it won't work.

Change-Id: I2d11c07a256917d12c46a7c302c5a5e8752a1df0
Task: 29543
Story: 2002535

commit_message:
Do not use OpenStack services clients from Vitrage

This patch adds python-*client initialization inside
vitrage-tempest-plugin.

Also for CLI calls all auth params are taken from config now.
Configuration via environment variables is not supported.

Story: 2004053
Task: 27631
Task: 28634
Change-Id: If873d36b4785369127cd3b4f8ce8ab64f09dc2b6

commit_message:
update interface.yaml with ignores and maintainer

The ignores removes all files that are not relevant to
the interface from the built charm, and thus, the
runtime imports of the interface bits

Change-Id: I4d5c58fff7d05dc10eea54567fbabb579a9ddd71

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 14:09:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gate issues on master

This addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

Change-Id: I3672e94471fc38d42c77896241f495944dc9b10b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate issues on master

This addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

Change-Id: I3672e94471fc38d42c77896241f495944dc9b10b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 19:47:40.000000000', 'message': "Suppress pylint warnings from dell_emc drivers

The dell_emc driver imports a library that doesn't ship
with OpenStack so suppress the pylint warnings about not being
able to import it.  Also suppress a pylint warning in the test
code due to the way a mock.assert is used since it is legitimate
but pylint has no way to tell it from cases where we should
be warned when there is access to a non-existent member of an
object.

commit_message:
Suppress pylint warnings from dell_emc drivers

The dell_emc driver imports a library that doesn't ship
with OpenStack so suppress the pylint warnings about not being
able to import it.

Change-Id: I0ecb72d85f655a01567a22b9d45b1815e96e3245

commit_message:
Add new base for containers-build and periodic without files:

As tracked in [1] in order to use the upstream as base in the
periodic containers build job, we need the base to *not* have any
files: defined otherwise zuul refuses to run it. There is more
info on this bug at [2]

This adds new tripleo-build-containers-base in the base.yaml file
and the existing job then parents onto that see [3]

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/712
[2] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2005040
[3] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/18896/
Change-Id: I7520b19eb85069e5d75c000f73cbc3499fedeec7

monitorstack for openstack services was added to site however to this is
not quite ready yet so its been removed from site and will remain as a
beta capability for the time being.

commit_message:
Use one ConfigOpts in placement-status

Because of a conflict between how the oslo.upgradecheck library uses
oslo config and how we want to use it in placement, two different
ConfigOpts were needed to avoid an args already parsed error. The
new release of the oslo.upgradecheck library is change to allow
the two steps in main (registering the CLI opts and running the
command) to be called separately if desired. Doing so allows us
to use just one ConfigOpts.

Requirements and constraints are updated.

Change-Id: I792df18cb17da95659628bfe7f7a69897c6f37ab

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for redis

The default command wasn't working, here we set one that will actually work.

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place
and instead of restarting stunnel, triggers a configuration reload.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I437d69fef45d1662e8908c5ca0f7063be6cb9b32

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for RabbitMQ

The default command wasn't working, here we set one that will actually work.

The script additionally copies the certificates in the right place
and instead of restarting RabbitMQ, it triggers a pem cache reload.

commit_message:
TLS everywhere: Set post-save command for httpd

The default command wasn't working, so here we set one that will
actually work.

httpd is a fairly simple instance, since the certs are mounted from the
directory (and not the individual certs). So there is no need to copy
anything to the container or do any post-processing. All we need to do
is tell httpd to load the new certs.

Related-Bug: #1811401
Depends-On: I642f48aa0e66ca57de2ecee921c798747ba41e1a
Change-Id: I862f0d15f769167c8b5d27cf302b7087b8fad0ab
(cherry picked from commit 514f99c575151489bdfef0cde01a0ebd57e5e131)

commit_message:
mini-mirror: Add ingress

Currently, services rely on an in-cluster service address in order to
interact with mini-mirror. This change introduces support for cluster
ingress so services or nodes may resolve mini-mirror from outside a
cluster.

Change-Id: I5cc451de3f3e1be7d046bf9ca50b1ad53682d01b

commit_message:
Remove obsolete creation_counter field

creation_counter is never used in fields.py and was deprecated in
Django 2.x. Fields of object are keeped internally as ordered
dictionary, so we don't need any additional tools to manage it

Related Django bug:
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/23919#comment:95

Change-Id: I530a47ad8bfed6aef63d0a678a69fa09288f123e

[{'created': '2019-02-19 22:42:14.000000000', 'message': "Enable DIB_SHOW_IMAGE_USAGE for build

This prints a report in the dib output logs of files and directories
over 10MiB in size.

There is some history behind this.  It was originally enabled in
nodepool for all builds, but disabled after we started seeing hangs
reading from pipes [1,2].

A lot has changed since then.  This was Python 2 on trusty hosts.  We
are now python 3 on Xenial hosts and the logging capture has been
rewritten [3].  This is also enabled in our gate tests for all builds
[4] and has not caused problems (though there is much less in the
images).

Note this doesn't actually increase build time -- dib already does the
du to figure out how big to make the loopback image as is.  This
re-enables it for all builds.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/357393
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2016-08-18.log.html#t2016-08-18T20:49:51

Change-Id: Iea8b101d723205b30d4a757eaeadb0dccb7243f5
"}]
commit_message:
Enable DIB_SHOW_IMAGE_USAGE for build

This prints a report in the dib output logs of files and directories
over 10MiB in size.

There is some history behind this.  It was originally enabled in
nodepool for all builds, but disabled after we started seeing hangs
reading from pipes [1,2].

A lot has changed since then.  This was Python 2 on trusty hosts.  We
are now python 3 on Xenial hosts and the logging capture has been
rewritten [3].  This is also enabled in our gate tests for all builds
[4] and has not caused problems (though there is much less in the
images).

Note this doesn't actually increase build time -- dib already does the
du to figure out how big to make the loopback image as is.  This
re-enables it for all builds.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/357393
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2016-08-18.log.html#t2016-08-18T20:49:51
[3] https://review.openstack.org/633792
[4] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/nodepool/tree/devstack/plugin.sh#n479

Change-Id: Iea8b101d723205b30d4a757eaeadb0dccb7243f5

commit_message:
stop using common db mixin methods

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin.

This commit also includes the following unrelated change
to pass the gate.
----------------------------------------

commit_message:
Update placement-status-checks history

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632599/ added a new check for missing
root provider ids, but missed to update the placement-status-checks
history in the doc, so this patch updates it.

Change-Id: I8f5dc7b25ded628772d3863e4ccecb14b5224c58
